BOOK.TITLE: The Great Gatsby
BOOK.AUTHOR: F. Scott Fitzgerald
BOOK.DESCRIPTION: A classic American novel set in the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

BOOK.TITLE: To Kill a Mockingbird
BOOK.AUTHOR: Harper Lee
BOOK.DESCRIPTION: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South during the 1930s.

BOOK.AUTHOR: George Orwell
BOOK.DESCRIPTION: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about totalitarianism and surveillance.

BOOK.TITLE: Pride and Prejudice
BOOK.AUTHOR: Jane Austen
BOOK.DESCRIPTION: A romantic novel of manners that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

BOOK.TITLE: The Catcher in the Rye
BOOK.AUTHOR: J.D. Salinger
BOOK.DESCRIPTION: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation, narrated by the cynical Holden Caulfield.
